snippet: In a deal that could lead to Japan’s first major steps toward reducing its debt, Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda agreed with two opposition parties on legislation to double the consumption tax.
abstract: Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda agrees with Japan’s two largest opposition parties on legislation to double the country’s consumption tax; it is a deal that could lead to Japan’s first substantial steps toward reducing its burgeoning debt burden.
lead_paragraph: In a deal that could lead to Japan’s first major steps toward reducing its debt, Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda agreed with two opposition parties on legislation to double the consumption tax.

headline.main: Japan Reaches Tax Deal That Could Help Shrink Debt
headline.print_headline: Deal in Japan to Increase a Tax Aims to Trim the Nation’s Debt
